context_of_use: This use case allows urban mobility planners to set up and modify various traffic control measures to analyze their effects.
stakeholders_and_interests: urban mobility planner: to validate urban mobility proposals
description: This use case enables urban mobility planners to configure and assess the impact of different traffic measures.
triggering_event: The urban mobility planner initiates the configuration of traffic measures.
preconditions: The urban mobility planner is logged into the Traffic Management System.
postconditions: Traffic measures are configured and ready for analysis.
The urban mobility planner can review the effects of the configured measures.
assumptions: The system has the capability to modify traffic measures.
The urban mobility planner has the necessary permissions to configure traffic measures.
requirements_met: The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to adjust speed limits.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to switch lane directions.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to model roundabouts.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to model adaptive traffic lights.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to close roads.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to increase traffic in certain locations.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to simulate traffic crises.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the specific traffic measures available for configuration.
main_flow: 1. urban mobility planner → The system displays the traffic measures configuration interface.
2. urban mobility planner adjusts speed limits → The system updates the speed limits.
3. urban mobility planner switches lane directions → The system updates the lane directions.
4. urban mobility planner models roundabouts → The system incorporates the roundabouts into the traffic model.
5. urban mobility planner models adaptive traffic lights → The system integrates the adaptive traffic lights into the traffic model.
6. urban mobility planner closes roads → The system marks the roads as closed.
7. urban mobility planner increases traffic in locations → The system simulates increased traffic in specified areas.
8. urban mobility planner simulates traffic crises → The system prepares the traffic model for crisis scenarios.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the urban mobility planner decides to cancel the speed limit adjustment, then the system retains the previous speed limits.
AF-2 (from Step 3): If the urban mobility planner encounters an invalid lane direction, then the system prompts for a valid direction before proceeding.
AF-3 (from Step 6): If the urban mobility planner attempts to close a road that is currently in use, then the system alerts the planner and suggests alternative measures.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the system fails to display the traffic measures configuration interface, then the urban mobility planner receives an error message and must retry.
EF-2 (from Step 5): If the system cannot integrate the adaptive traffic lights due to a technical issue, then the urban mobility planner is notified and the integration is logged for review.
